titleStmt.title: Receipt for payment of wheat
titleStmt.author: Didymos alias Louris, son of Lysimachos

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Didumos also called Lourios, son of Lusimachos, to Lysimachos son of Pasion, greeting. I have received from you the price of bought wheat which you have deducted from the public bank from the credit of Ptolema daughter of Didymos, at Kerkesephis, 5 1/4 artabas of wheat, and from the credit of Tamystha daughter of Lysimachos, at Tebtunis, 1 1/2 artabas, and at Kerkeosiris likewise 1 1/2. Together the total is 8 1/4 artabas, making at 7 drachmas per artaba the sum of fifty-seven drachmas, four and a half obols, total 57 dr. 4 1/2 ob. The 12th year of Antoninus Caesar the lord, Phamenoth 27.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.394 See R. Bogaert, Ancient Society v. 19 (1988), p. 220-222.
